index.title: Path of Exile 2: The Next Generation Free-to-Play Action RPG
index.description: Path of Exile 2 is a groundbreaking action RPG sequel with a new campaign, revamped skills, and enhanced customization, set 20 years after the original.

hero.title: Path of Exile 2
hero.subtitle: The Next Generation Free-to-Play Action RPG
hero.content: In Path of Exile 2, players will face an ancient evil threatening Wraeclast. The campaign includes seven acts, featuring new areas, towns, and characters, alongside some returning favorites. The game features six new character classes, each with two Ascendancy classes available at launch. Players can expect deep build crafting opportunities as they progress through the game.

about.title: About Path of Exile 2
content: Path of Exile 2 is a sequel to the original Path of Exile, set 20 years after the original. Initially planned as a graphics update, it evolved into a standalone game to preserve the original gameplay.

Both games coexist, offering unique mechanics and balanced gameplay. The sequel introduces a fresh six-act campaign, a revamped skill gem system, and enhanced character customization with a redesigned passive skill tree, including dual specialization.

characters.title: Path of Exile 2 Classes
characters.subtitle: Explore the 6 character classes in Path of Exile 2

content.name: Warrior
content.intro: The Warrior in Path of Exile 2 pounds the ground with big, chunky attacks and can shrug off the hits of smaller enemies with large amounts of armour.

ascendancies.name: Titan
ascendancies.description: The Titan focuses on stuns, slams, and beefy defence. Call upon your ancestors to boost your slams. Push your enemies to the ground. Shrug off any attack.

ascendancies.name: Warbringer
ascendancies.description: This fearsome frontline fighter conjures ancestral spirits to pummel his foes and has a voice so powerful his Warcries can detonate his fallen enemies.

content.name: Sorceress
content.intro: The Sorceress bends the elements to her will, using them to unleash devastation on her foes. This classic spellcaster weaves a flurry of elemental magic from afar.

ascendancies.name: Stormweaver
ascendancies.description: Become a master of the elements who can cast faster, hit harder, and chill and shock enemies en masse. The Stormweaver can even conjure devastating Elemental Storms.

ascendancies.name: Chronomancer
ascendancies.description: The Chronomancer wields powerful temporal magic that can reset cooldowns, slow enemies in her presence, and even freeze time itself.

content.name: Ranger
content.intro: The Ranger class in Path of Exile 2 is quick, but deadly, peppering her enemies with arrows and then vaulting away before they have a chance to reach her.

ascendancies.name: Deadeye
ascendancies.description: This expert marksman can take down foes with style. She moves as fast as the wind, and can nock additional arrows with every draw.

ascendancies.name: Pathfinder
ascendancies.description: Pathfinder is a master of flasks and poison. She can turn mana potions into chemical weapons, and stack poisons to her heart's content.

content.name: Monk
content.intro: The Monk is a fast and furious melee fighter. He dashes in and out of combat, and has mechanics that involve building up and keeping momentum.

ascendancies.name: Invoker
ascendancies.description: The Invoker wields the elements with ease and can use that power to become an Elemental Avatar. The Invoker is also a master of the Spirit allowing him to use many abilities without lifting a finger.

ascendancies.name: Acolyte of Chayula
ascendancies.description: The Acolyte of Chayula exchanges mastery of Spirit for Darkness, a resource that can be utilized to both absorb and deal damage. Summoning power from the Breach, he trades elemental affinity for Chaos.

content.name: Mercenary
content.intro: The Mercenary wields a crossbow that can be loaded with different ammo types, offering versatility, power, and mobility. He also has options to combo abilities together to devastating effect.

ascendancies.name: Witchhunter
ascendancies.description: The Witchhunter specialises in taking down the most deadly of foes. With extra defences against magic, and the ability to break the concentration of his enemies, he is perfectly suited for slaughtering spellcasters.

ascendancies.name: Gemling Legionnaire
ascendancies.description: Enhance your abilities by embedding Gems directly into your flesh. The Gemling Legionnaire can use more skills than any other class, and the more he uses, the more powerful he becomes.

content.name: Witch
content.intro: Death and decay are the Witch's weapons of choice. She can call forth hordes of undead minions to fight for her while casting powerful chaos spells.

ascendancies.name: Blood Mage
ascendancies.description: Become a master of life energy. The Blood Mage uses her own life as a resource to bring destruction to her enemies.

ascendancies.name: Infernalist
ascendancies.description: Infernalist transcends the need for mana, instead building heat as she casts spells. With an Infernal hound at her side she can even turn into a demon herself.

gameplay.title: Dive Into the World of Path of Exile 2
gameplay.subtitle: Experience enhanced combat mechanics and innovative gameplay systems

content.title: Visceral Combat
content.content: Path of Exile 2 emphasizes smooth melee combat, allowing for retargeting during ability animations. This enhances movement freedom and enables players to correct misses during combat, making Path of Exile 2's combat system truly visceral.

content.title: Ability Cost Mechanics
content.content: In Path of Exile 2, the resource cost of using abilities is now spread across the full animation time, reducing penalties for canceling abilities mid-animation. This change enhances combat fluidity and allows for more strategic gameplay.

content.title: Dodge Rolling Mechanic
content.content: All characters in Path of Exile 2 have access to a dodge roll that cancels current actions and animations. It allows players to avoid projectiles and strikes but does not increase movement speed. Dodge rolling is crucial for evasion during boss fights.

content.title: Accuracy Rating
content.content: In Path of Exile 2, accuracy rating determines the hit chance of an attack, which is influenced by character gear and the passive skill tree. Monsters' evasion is based on their level and modifiers, and specific mechanics can bypass accuracy requirements.

content.title: Spirit Resource
content.content: Path of Exile 2 introduces a new resource called Spirit, which is used for reservation skills and maintaining permanent minions. Spirit comes primarily from equipment modifiers and the passive skill tree.

content.title: Leech Mechanic
content.content: The leech system in Path of Exile 2 has been simplified, with two main modifiers: damage dealt percentage and leech resistance on monsters. This balances character damage growth against monster resistance.

content.title: Energy Shield Recovery
content.content: In Path of Exile 2, energy shield recovers at a rate of 33.3% per second after four seconds without taking damage. Poison and bleeding damage bypass energy shield, hitting life directly.

ingame.title: Explore More Fun Features of Path of Exile 2
ingame.subtitle: Discover the extensive features that await you

content.title: Skill Gem System Overhaul
content.content: The skill gem system has been completely reworked. Skill gems are now linked directly to characters rather than gear, allowing support gems to be attached directly to skill gems, which simplifies build diversity.

content.title: New Weapon Types
content.content: Path of Exile 2 introduces new weapon types such as spears, crossbows, and a hybrid ranged/melee spear, enhancing build customization options in the game.

content.title: Unique Boss Encounters
content.content: Path of Exile 2 features over 100 unique bosses, each with specialized maps and revamped fight mechanics that require critical thinking and skillful movement from players.

content.title: Cross-Play and Cross-Progression
content.content: Path of Exile 2 supports local couch co-op, cross-play, and cross-progression across different platforms, allowing players to use the same character on various consoles or PCs.

content.title: Dynamic Environment Interactions
content.content: Players must navigate skillfully through boss stages using the new dodge mechanic while avoiding attacks, favoring precise movements over simple gear checks.

content.title: Enhanced Visuals and Animations
content.content: Combat animations have been improved to create a more fluid and responsive feel, making each weapon feel distinct in terms of functionality during battles.

reviews.title: What Players Say About Path of Exile 2
reviews.subtitle: What players and critics are saying

content.name: Game Connoisseur
content.content: Path of Exile 2 isn't just an excellent game; it's a groundbreaking achievement. It builds upon its predecessor, setting a new standard for action RPGs.

content.name: RPG Enthusiast
content.content: The core gameplay feels both familiar and refreshingly new. Where Path of Exile 2 truly shines is in the depth and breadth of its content.

content.name: Skill Tree Expert
content.content: Its famous massive skill tree and labyrinthine maps elevate the gaming experience to a scale few games dare to attempt.

content.name: Sound Aficionado
content.content: The voice acting, music, and updated character models are all outstanding, giving a fresh feel to Path of Exile 2.

content.name: Efficiency Player
content.content: Path of Exile 2 has added some quality of life improvements, like being able to summon quest NPCs directly instead of having to return to town to talk to them.

content.name: Content Creator
content.content: The main storyline of Path of Exile 2 takes about 35 to 40 hours, but there's a ton of endgame content after that... it feels like three games in one.

faq.title: Path of Exile 2 FAQs
faq.subtitle: Get answers to common questions about Path of Exile 2

content.question: When does Path of Exile 2 Early Access start?
content.answer: Path of Exile 2 launches in Early Access on December 6th at 11am PST (December 7th, 3:00 AM GMT+8) across all supported platforms including PC (standalone, Steam, Epic Games Store), Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 5. Note that MacOS support is not available at launch but is planned for the future.

content.question: How can I join Early Access?
content.answer: You can join Path of Exile 2 Early Access by purchasing one of the new Early Access Supporter Packs. Additionally, players who have previously spent $480 USD on a single platform will automatically receive access.

content.question: How do you redeem an Early Access key?
content.answer: When you purchase a supporter pack that includes Path of Exile 2 Early Access, the key is automatically redeemed on your account. For example, if you purchase through the website, you'll be able to claim a key for your Steam library.

content.question: When can I download the game client?
content.answer: The standalone PC client for Path of Exile 2 will be available for pre-download starting December 5th at 5pm PST. Xbox pre-download is already available, and other platforms will follow shortly before launch.

content.question: What content is included in Early Access?
content.answer: Path of Exile 2 Early Access includes the first three acts of the campaign, the Atlas endgame system, over 50 unique boss encounters, and more than 400 different monster types to challenge.

content.question: Are Supporter Packs available on consoles?
content.answer: Yes, Path of Exile 2 Early Access Supporter Packs are available on Xbox now, with PlayStation Store availability starting December 6th PST. Console purchases include access to both PoE 1 and PoE 2 content.

content.question: Will there be microtransactions in Early Access?
content.answer: Yes, Path of Exile 2 will feature a selection of microtransactions from the original game during Early Access. New microtransactions specific to PoE 2 will be added in future updates.

content.question: Will my Path of Exile 1 microtransactions work in Early Access?
content.answer: Yes, Path of Exile 1 transactions will be ported over to Path of Exile 2.

content.question: Will there be wipes during Early Access?
content.answer: No, characters created during this period will be placed in the Path of Exile 2 "Early Access" League but will remain separate from the Standard League.

content.question: Is couch co-op available in Early Access?
content.answer: Yes, you can play Path of Exile 2 in couch co-op mode on a single account right from the start. The second player will be able to create a character on that account.

content.question: Does Path of Exile 2 feature cross-play?
content.answer: Yes, it supports complete cross-play across different platforms. Including PC, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 5.

content.question: Is there an offline mode for Path of Exile 2?
content.answer: No, Path of Exile 2 is strictly an online experience requiring a stable internet connection to play on both PC and consoles.

content.question: Can I stream or share my Early Access gameplay?
content.answer: Yes! Path of Exile 2 Early Access has no NDA, so you're free to stream, share screenshots, and discuss your experiences with the community.
